comments.body: Actually, someone suggested another fun idea, "Counting Coup" that is sneaking up on the Warden and then Shearing them for an item and getting achievement. Which honestly complies with the "Do Not Kill" but also rewards player skills against a dangerous mob. Afterall there's hardly any greater show of skill than proving you could kill/best and enemy without sheding blood.
Tbh calcite is actually one of, if not, the most common mineral on earth so it should be everywhere
ive found that animals are not running away when being hit even mulitple times afterwards are not running away
Too little coal and iron generation under y=0
Spaghetti caves and noodle caves are too dense, so it is suggested to reduce their generation frequency.
Please please please please please please please have the large biomes customization for 1.18!!!!!!!!!!

Mountain Range generation in Snapshot 3 of 1.18 is really cool with the new additions.

However, I noticed that most of the generation of mountains are circular or blobs when they form the peaks. It would be pretty interesting to have varation in this with "linear" larger generation of mountain without apexes ( this could apply more to the smaller mountains than the larger lofty peaks ).

Also, most of the larger mountains consist of the body of one large peak with many other sticking out of it to form the varied landscape, it would be also quite cool if there would be a higher chance of multiple of these large mountains were to generate together forming the original biome around it to be a valley between the moutains (again this could apply more to the smaller ones for the sake of gradient of the slopes). This could also conincide with the chance of larger biomes with more microbiomes within them.
The problem I have is than goats have no use.

Would love to see higher mountains. Mountains in a "range" would be amazing!

Too many big caves. Huge caves should be rarer to make it more epic when you find one.

Can't wait for this to be released!!
I want it
if you have java you can just play in previous versions

I so want this. The new caves are the worst. Too dark, too big, too many monsters. Now I don’t bother mining in caves because of it. Need it for bedrock definitely, as ipad can’t go back to old versions like pc can :/

I like the fact of the brain leech but I think the player should still be able to control them self but I think that after a while you start to get infected and the only way to cure yourself is to eat a golden apple or die
that's a bit harsh.

This mob idea seems like it would be completely unbalanced and overall just an unfun addition to the game.

The first problem comes from how it spawns. Large bodies of water in the Deep Dark would be a very uncommon sight for most players, making the chances of encountering such a enemy extremely low.

But if one did, the effects would be disastrous and completely kill the fun one is having playing the game. Taking control away from a player is not a fun mechanic in almost every case. And could cause great frustration and difficulty with interacting with the games other mechanics. Especially with such a tedious and difficult "cure" functionality. Simply dying is not a viable option for the hardcore player base. Golems only naturally spawn in villages, which could be hundreds of blocks away. Either walking hundreds of blocks or trying to gather the resources to build a Golem while the Leech augments your controls and inputs would be, for rather obvious reasons, tedious and completely unfun.

It's drops also seem underwhelming for the great tedium and harshness of dealing with the mob. A splash potion like effect that makes mobs run away from a particular area would have very limited use in most gameplay scenarios, and is vastly obsolete when compared to other options already offered by the game. 

I highly suggest rethinking how this mob and its mechanics would appear and function in game. I do not wish to discourage you! Nobody gets things right the first time after all!
Wouldn't this feature not be used seeing cobblestone is waaaay more common than clay or bricks?
it would be a use for the previously (nearly) unused bricks item, if not a very common one, as you need a furnace to get bricks...
Sandstone - could also come in handy.

Yes, the player needs a furnace to make bricks. But what if the player already has one furnace and needs more? In addition, you can add the mechanics of making bricks at the campfire. Not to mention that the player can get bricks from encountered buildings.
It would be cool if aqua affinity applied to mining instead of having a new enchant too

I like the idea, though maybe it is too modern, it would be like the elytra. (you need to sacrifice an armor slot)

Also, it could be made from the following materials: 2 amethyst shards, 2 prismarine shards, 2 copper ingots, 1 rabbit hide, and 1 shulker shell. the shulker shell makes them impossible to get until after the ender dragon is defeated, like the elytra. 

Alternatively, they could replace the shulker shell with a netherite scrap, which would not be AS hard to get, but will still pose a challenge.
I love this idea but don’t you think it’s to high tech for Minecraft?

I agree that it might be a little bit high tech as an item, discounting what you can do with red stone. I would imagine it as more of a miner's helmet than some futuristic goggles though, probably putting it at the same complexity level as a jukebox or note block. I like the idea of using shulker shells to put it at a more of a late game item, as it would probably be too easy to get it early game, but netherite wouldn't really fit the idea of the goggles.
The mountains are easy to find, and if you have an elytra it is even easier, and in lore, well you are proposing lore without knowing in a certain way the true lore of minecraft...

Nobody knows the true lore of Minecraft because there simply is no "true" lore. You invent the lore. Developers just add different elements that you could tie together in any way you want. Therefore the idea is nice from a lore perspective, but not very useful from a gameplay perspective, since Mountains are not as rare as Badlands, for instance.

I just played the 1.18 snapshot, and I love it, but it could use some changes. 

1. The mountain generation is incredible, but absolutely NUTS! For example, I was in creative, flying around, and massive random floating islands and 1 by 1 pillars shot out. I recommend maybe smoothing out the hill generation to make it look more natural.

2. The caves are awesome, but they take over a lot. For example, I was in a village and a big exposed dripstone cave cut right in front of a villager house. I recommend having the caves be underground if within 15 blocks of a structure, so they don't overlap.

From: PatientFlame196

can you add a placeholder deep dark biome and add it to worldgen for datapacks users to make there own

like my deep dark preview pack this is it deep dark preview Minecraft Data Pack (planetminecraft.com) look for minecraft:deep_dark

I have tested the experimental snapshot 1, 2, 3 & 4 all in survival. Each time Steve died I have started a new random word. 95% I played the seed that was given to me.

I’m a big fan of the new world generation, but I have no idea how you want to make it upwards compatible with 1.17 world generation.

Here are some remarks:

The new mountains are exiting and inviting to explore. On top they are well integrated.

The caves are a totally new experience. The big once come with wow effect. I particular like the implementation of the small and more claustrophobic one.

Playing 1.18 for a while I come up with an issue list related to game play:

Biome placement:

The new temperature map is a phantastic enhancement. Gives a more consistence and intuitive feeling. I have not issue with micro biomes, as long as the overall generation fits together.

Dessert:

Deserts are a bit boring. There are mostly smooth. I’m missing some more stony sections, with a bit higher local noise level. I like sandstone as building block. Currently the only place to get bigger amount of sandstone are some of sockets of the pyramids. But also, these are back to a reasonable size in the 4th snapshot. I like the idea of less water filled rivers in dry biomes.

Fix: I would add some more stony and harsh desert areas where the desert reaches out to cliffs or hilly / mountain areas.

Overall, 1.18 is inviting the player to spend more time to explore the environment both above and below the surface. It takes longer to select a place for living. If you want to test out all the new functionality available mining can get stressful. In general mining is more time consuming. You must go to different levels to find the ores. Iron is always short in all phases of the game, but there is sufficient iron available if the player does know, where to search.

I do not recommend increasing iron availability above the 4th snapshot. Instead I would give cupper more use cases where it makes sense. I propose to have alternative recipes for buckets, cauldrons, hoppers and bars. Where iron gets replaced by cupper. This would not have a big impact on the game mechanics but reduce the shortage of iron a bit. Iron cauldrons, hoppers and bars would have the same functionality but should have their unique look

Powder snow is nice feature added in 1.18 would generation.

It is a new challenge in traveling around mountain areas I don’t want to miss.

There are serios issues for pets, if you build a base or travel around in area with powered snow that needs adaptions in the game.

Dogs might freeze to death to follow Steven in power snow. Path finding needs to be improved to avoid powder snow.

Llamas of wandering trader might freeze. To me this is a bug as the should be protected by waring a carpet. Carpets should protect Llamas in general from freezing.

There is now way to protect donkeys from freezing but they are living in meadows nearby powder snow. I there should be a way to make them capable to deal with this.

By the way: horse riding is much improved in 1.18.  Although there is more difference in would hight there is nearly allways a ridable path. Rivers have frequently cross over points.

Well done.
Like like a goat spear or a musical instrument

I agree, the void should have a creepy and unsettling vibe.

But the strip mine idea is unnecessary in my opinion.

The fog effect near the void that old versions had could be re-added but maybe lighter.

And I also don't think your idea is too scary because cave sounds exist and are scary as well
Thx!!!!! for commenting.Yea its just like to give it a little creepy vibe but not compare it to the warden.That thing give me nightmares.And also the cave sound... I think it was 18
PLZ DO ARCHEOLOGY I BEEN WAITING FOR AGES FOR THE BRUSH AND POTS PLZ PLZ PLZ DO THIS I BEG

Besides, you are never forced to do anything in the game. If you're so afraid of the Deep Dark or you just like being invincible in the late-game, just avoid the Deep Dark as a whole. You can even play Peaceful or avoid the negative Y-levels if you don't want the jumpscare at all (which is literally everywhere in the game so I don't know why you'd be fretting about it). Adding an item like the one some people are redundantly asking for just defeats the purpose of the biome as a whole and ruins the gameplay for everyone, because obviously if you're given an easier solution for an in-game situation, you're gonna go with it even if it's not as fun (Just look at Iron farms).

THEY HAVE CONFIRMED A THOUSAND TIMES THAT THERE WON'T BE SUCH AN ENCHANTMENT, NOR WOULD THERE EVER BE AN "EASY" WAY TO DEFEAT THE WARDEN. KINGBDOGZ SAID THAT FIGHTING THE WARDEN WILL BE SUICIDE. This just defeats the entire point! Why do you need to fight it? Why do you need a way to just go past it? Is it that hard to literally sneak?! Let the developers implement the gameplay they're aiming for without spamming them with ideas they said 90% of the time that they won't do. That tweet Kingbdogz said back in February was more than overwritten by everything else he said afterwards. The reason he was considering an item that lets you go past the Warden without stealthing was because he buffed the Warden so much to the point that he was pondering if it would be too overboard/scary for players (he said so). Plus, he mentioned an EXTREMELY late game item (not a gOaT hOrN or EnChAnTmEnT). Nobody thinks too scary should be a concern, according to almost all of the replies he got.

Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.  

Title: “Goatskin”  

Text: “I would add goatskin for leather armor. And for an (extended) backpack” 

- Translated by Admin

We don't need more drops from mobs. We already know there would be loot from mysterious structures within the Deep Dark. Also, how does that solve the "problem/dilema"? The criticizm around the idea of Warden drops is that it incentivizes killing the Warden and defeats its design, and they seem to have been getting stronger on that stance overtime. Quite a few replies from Kingbdogz confirm that Mojang is firm on making the Warden a disaster that you stealth around; it's not going to be a combat situation (to quote one of his replies). So having valuable drops for it (or from minions that spawn when it is killed) is really not a debate by now. Stop trying to find ways to kill it. You don't need to kill every mob in the game. It's not going to be a boss, so don't even bother worrying about it. I'm almost sure that it won't be required for the "Monsters Hunted" advancement, either.
This would make the glow squid even more useful.
heck no!

Do you mean lead metal?

I have some ideas for potential features:

- Lead nugget together with a fishing rod to fish for fish deep beneath the surface.

- Lead ingot instead of flint to make crossbow bolts for shooting through blocks.

- Lead nugged brewed with a water bottle makes potion of poison.

- Redstone component with lead could detect heat like lava or fire near it.

- Lead tools and armor would slow the user, but poison the enemy.

- Pistons could move lead blocks in any direction but up.

- Lead armor would make you sink much faster in water.

- Lead items would stay at the bottom if thrown in water.

- Lead ore should spawn together with gold sometimes, otherwise only as a single block.
Added mineral lead, that could lead to also melting lead to make ammunition for muskets, since there's already gunpowder
